translations: ‘sie richteten sich übel zu mit Steinen’;

Preterit.turoyo: U zlam mpalpaxle i aṯto baq qayse (İlyas p.c)
translations: The man beat up the wife with wooden sticks.

Preterit.turoyo: Lә tre zlamat mqatalle, mpalpaxxe ḥḏoḏe. (İlyas p.c)
translations: Two men fought, they beat each other up.

Preterite.turoyo: U zlam nafәl mi goro mpalpxi ag garmayḏe. (İlyas p.c)
translations: The man fell from the roof his bones broke.

Preterit.turoyo: 1.aḥ ḥәmṣe mpaxpxi ʕal u dawqo. (ilyas p.c)
translations: Chickpeans burst open on a frying pan.
